meanings.sent1: After forgetting about the pot on the stove, she had to reboil the water for her tea.
meanings.sent2: If the soup gets cold, you can simply reboil it to make it hot again.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally reboiled the pasta three times, making it extra soft.
meanings.sent4: Her anger reboiled when she saw the mess in the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The water reboils, bubbling and steaming as it heats up once more.

meanings.sent1: The water reboils after you add more ingredients to the pot.
meanings.sent2: If the pot is left on the stove, the soup reboils on its own.
meanings.sent3: The excitement reboils in him as he watches the thrilling movie.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for cooking reboils every time she enters the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the room reboils, creating a palpable atmosphere.
